briefTitle: Analgesic Benefit of PECS Blocks for Biceps Tenodesis Shoulder Surgery

armGroups.label: Interscalene Block plus Sham Block
interventionNames: Drug: Solution for Injection in Interscalene Block
Drug: Solution for Injection in Sham Block

armGroups.label: Interscalene plus PECS Blocks
interventionNames: Drug: Solution for Injection in Interscalene Block
Drug: Solution for Injection PECS Blocks

interventions.name: Solution for Injection in Interscalene Block
Solution for Injection in Sham Block

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults, between 18 and 80 years of age
* Ability to take pills
* Agreement to a regional with general anesthesia technique

Exclusion Criteria:

* Allergy to amide local anesthetics
* Presence of a progressive neurological deficit
* pre-existing coagulopathy
* Current infection
* Significant pulmonary disease contraindicating phrenic nerve blockade
* Chronic use of an opioid analgesic (\>3 months of a combined total of more than 40mg oxycodone equivalents a day)
* Inability to obtain ultrasound images of anatomy due to obesity.
* Pregnancy

outcomeMeasures.title: Post-operative Axillary Pain
outcomeMeasures.description: Post-operative ambulatory surgery subjects will be asked 6 hours after block placement about the presence of axillary pain at rest. Numerical Rating Scale scores (0-10) will be recorded with 0= no pain, 10=most pain possible. Higher scores denotes worse outcome.

outcomeMeasures.title: Numerical Rating Scale Pain Scores (0-10) at Rest
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjects were asked about their overall shoulder pain during the followup phone call at 24hrs post-block. Numerical Rating Scale scores (0-10) will be recorded with 0= no pain, 10=most pain possible. Higher scores denotes worse outcome.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Episodes of Nausea or Vomiting
outcomeMeasures.description: Any episodes during the first 24 hours will be recorded as a yes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Opioid Usage
outcomeMeasures.description: Recorded in oxycodone equivalents in the first 24 hours post-discharge from the PACU.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time From Block Placement to Onset of Axillary Pain
outcomeMeasures.description: Time self-reported by patients in the Interscalene Plus PECS Blocks group during data collection phone call at 24 hours post-block.
